p: It is our fervent hope that as more data comes to light, the arguments made in this piece may no longer be applicable. With more accurate, rapid, and available testing for COVID-19, including serum tests of markers of acute infection and immunity, the decision making will become more streamlined. In addition, if future evidence demonstrates a lack of infectivity of the aerosolized, blood, or fluid-borne viral particles, then the aforementioned discussions may become moot. Until such time, however, let us not allow blind allegiance to 1 approach be the primary factor determining surgical route. The best outcomes for all can be achieved when individual patient and local circumstances are considered, along with surgical experience and judgment.
